Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Prehabilitation in Esophagogastric Cancer Surgery

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults awaiting elective esophagogastric resection for cancer.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received preoperative exercise and nutrition optimization, while the control group received standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of prehabilitation in improving functional status in these patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in functional capacity, measured by the 6-minute walk distance (6MWD), assessed preoperatively and 4 to 8 weeks postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The prehabilitation group showed significant improvement in functional capacity compared to the control group both preoperatively (mean 6MWD change, 36.9 m vs −22.8 m; P < .001) and postoperatively (mean 6MWD change, 15.4 m vs −81.8 m; P < .001).
